globalShortcuts.name: SAP for Me
globalShortcuts.notes: One-stop hub for licenses, users, contracts, and entitlements. Your central SAP portal.

globalShortcuts.name: Cloud Service Status
globalShortcuts.notes: Green checkmarks = System is up. Red X = SAP outage. Check before troubleshooting.

globalShortcuts.name: SAP Support Portal
globalShortcuts.notes: Open incidents, search KBAs, check component ownership. Your first stop for issues.

globalShortcuts.name: SAP Community
globalShortcuts.notes: Q&A and best practices. Search before asking - 80% of questions already answered.

globalShortcuts.name: Discovery Center
globalShortcuts.notes: BTP cost estimator and reference architectures. Essential for planning cloud projects.

globalShortcuts.name: SAP Roadmap Explorer
globalShortcuts.notes: Use to answer: 'When is this feature coming?' Product roadmaps across SAP portfolio.

notes.content:
=== Universal Prompt Patterns (All SAP Solutions) ===

**Insight Request Pattern**:
"Analyze [object/scope] for [time period] and highlight [top drivers/risks/opportunities]. Present results as [table/summary/management brief]."

Example: "Analyze sales orders for Q1 2025 and highlight top 5 blockers. Present as management summary."

**Action + Explanation Pattern**:
"Perform [action] for [scope], then explain what you did and how it affects [business outcome]."

Example: "Create a draft invoice for PO 4500012345, then explain how this affects our cash flow forecast."

**Scenario Simulation Pattern**:
"Simulate [business change] and show the impact on [KPI] by [dimension], including recommendations."

Example: "Simulate a 10% price increase and show impact on revenue by product line with recommendations."

**Multi-Step Orchestration Pattern**:
"For [scope]: 1) [Step 1], 2) [Step 2], 3) [Step 3 with action]"

Example: "For customer ACME: 1) List open orders, 2) Flag risks, 3) Draft email to account manager with action plan."

=== Best Practices Across All Solutions ===

âœ“ **Be Specific**: Use exact field names, time ranges, thresholds
âœ“ **Specify Format**: "5 bullet points", "table", "draft email"
âœ“ **Use Follow-Ups**: "Make this shorter", "Add more technical detail"
âœ“ **Provide Context**: Include role, constraints, business goal
âœ“ **Iterate**: Start broad, then refine with follow-up prompts

=== Common Mistakes to Avoid ===

âœ— Too vague: "Show me sales data" â†’ âœ“ "Show top 10 customers by revenue for Q4 2024"
âœ— No time frame: "Analyze performance" â†’ âœ“ "Analyze performance for last 90 days"
âœ— No output format: "Give me info" â†’ âœ“ "Summarize in 3 bullet points"

=== Solution-Specific Prompt Libraries ===

For detailed prompt examples, see:
â€¢ SuccessFactors: Switch to SuccessFactors profile â†’ Notes â†’ "Joule Prompts Library - SuccessFactors"
â€¢ S/4HANA: Switch to S/4HANA profile â†’ Notes â†’ "Joule Prompts Library - S/4HANA Finance & ERP"
â€¢ BTP: Switch to BTP profile â†’ Notes â†’ "Joule Prompts Library - BTP & AI Core"
notes.title: ðŸ¤– Joule Prompt Engineering - Best Practices

notes.content:
=== SuccessFactors Joule ===
SAP Note 3377766 - Joule Copilot Activation for SuccessFactors
https://launchpad.support.sap.com/#/notes/3377766

Prerequisites:
â€¢ SuccessFactors H1 2025 release or later
â€¢ OAuth integration configured
â€¢ User roles: Joule User, Joule Admin

Activation Steps:
1. Admin Center â†’ System Configuration â†’ Joule Settings
2. Enable "Joule Copilot" toggle
3. Configure SSO (SAML 2.0)
4. Assign roles to users
5. Test: "Show my team's time off requests"

=== S/4HANA Joule ===
SAP Note 3391234 - Joule for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Activation
https://launchpad.support.sap.com/#/notes/3391234

Prerequisites:
â€¢ S/4HANA Cloud 2408 or later
â€¢ SAP Fiori launchpad configured
â€¢ BTP subaccount with AI services

Activation Steps:
1. Fiori Launchpad â†’ Manage Joule Settings
2. Connect BTP AI Core tenant
3. Enable role: SAP_BR_JOULE_USER
4. Test: "What's my cash position?"

=== SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) Joule ===
SAP Note 3405123 - Joule for SAP Analytics Cloud
https://launchpad.support.sap.com/#/notes/3405123

Prerequisites:
â€¢ SAC tenant on latest release
â€¢ Story creation permissions
â€¢ Data models published

Activation Steps:
1. SAC â†’ System â†’ Administration â†’ Joule
2. Enable "Natural Language Query"
3. Test: "Show revenue trend by region"

=== BTP Generative AI Hub ===
SAP Note 3405678 - BTP Generative AI Hub Setup
https://launchpad.support.sap.com/#/notes/3405678

Prerequisites:
â€¢ BTP global account with AI Units entitlement
â€¢ Cloud Foundry space with 2GB memory
â€¢ Service key for AI Core

Setup Steps:
1. BTP Cockpit â†’ AI Core â†’ Create Instance
2. Subscribe to Generative AI Hub service
3. Create destination to foundation models (GPT-4, Claude)
4. Build skills: https://joule-studio.build.cloud.sap

Common Issues & Fixes:
âŒ "Joule icon not showing" â†’ Clear browser cache + relogin
âŒ "OAuth error" â†’ Regenerate OAuth client secret
âŒ "No response" â†’ Check status: https://me.sap.com/app/availability

Additional Resources:
â€¢ Joule Community: https://community.sap.com/topics/joule
â€¢ Joule Help: https://help.sap.com/joule
â€¢ Joule Roadmap: https://roadmaps.sap.com/board?q=joule
notes.title: ðŸ”§ Joule Installation & Activation Guide (All Products)

notes.content:
FUE (Full Use Equivalent):
â€¢ Traditional SAP licensing model
â€¢ 1 FUE = 1 "power user" with full system access
â€¢ Used for: SuccessFactors, S/4HANA Cloud
â€¢ Ratios: 1 Advanced = 1 FUE | 5 Core = 1 FUE | 30 Self-Service = 1 FUE

PUPM (Per User Per Month):
â€¢ Cloud subscription model (monthly, pay-as-you-go)
â€¢ Used for: BTP services, SAP Analytics Cloud
â€¢ Example: $10/user/month for SAP Build

Business AI Pricing (NEW in 2026):
â€¢ Joule Base - Included in FUE license (no extra cost)
â€¢ Joule Premium Skills - $15/user/month add-on
â€¢ Generative AI Hub (BTP) - $0.50 per 1000 API calls
â€¢ Document Grounding - $5/user/month for custom content

Key Decision:
â€¢ FUE = Predictable annual costs (enterprise contracts)
â€¢ PUPM = Flexible monthly costs (startups, pilots)
â€¢ AI Add-ons = Usually PUPM, even if base product is FUE

Resources:
â€¢ SAP Store Pricing: https://store.sap.com
â€¢ License Calculator: https://me.sap.com/app/licenseutilization
notes.title: ðŸ’° AI Pricing: FUE vs PUPM (2026 Update)

notes.content:
Clean Core = Keep SAP standard, extend on BTP (no custom code in core).

Why Clean Core Matters:
âœ“ Quarterly cloud updates (not 6-12 month upgrade projects)
âœ“ 40-60% reduction in upgrade costs
âœ“ AI/Joule works out-of-box (doesn't break with custom code)
âœ“ Future-proof (no technical debt)

The 3 Rules of Clean Core:
1. Don't Modify Core - No Y- or Z-tables in SAP systems
2. Extend on BTP - Build side-by-side apps on BTP
3. Use APIs Only - No direct DB access, use SAP APIs

Common Challenges:
âœ— "We have 500 custom programs" - Start with top 20, migrate incrementally
âœ— "BTP is expensive" - TCO is lower than maintaining custom code
âœ— "Our business is unique" - 80% processes are industry-standard

Migration Path:
1. Identify custom code (Transaction: /SDF/CD_CBA)
2. Classify: Keep, Replace with SAP Standard, Rebuild on BTP
3. Use Extensibility Explorer: https://sap.com/extends4

Key Resources:
â€¢ Clean Core Checker: https://support.sap.com/cleancore
â€¢ SAP Signavio (Process Mining): https://signavio.com
notes.title: ðŸ§¹ Move to Clean Core (2026 Reality Check)

notes.content:
SAP RISE = ERP Transformation as a Service
â€¢ All-in-one: S/4HANA + BTP + Business AI + Infrastructure
â€¢ Subscription model (no more perpetual licenses)
â€¢ Includes: Hyperscaler hosting (AWS/Azure/GCP) + managed services
â€¢ Target: Mid-to-large enterprises (>$100M revenue)

SAP GROW = SMB-Focused Cloud ERP
â€¢ S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (pre-configured)
â€¢ Faster implementation (3-6 months vs 12-18 months)
â€¢ Lower cost ($200-500/user/month all-in)
â€¢ Target: SMBs (<$100M revenue)

Key Differences:
Feature | RISE | GROW
Implementation | 12-18 months | 3-6 months
Customization | Moderate (BTP extensions) | Minimal (out-of-box)
Price | $500-2000/user/year | $200-500/user/month
Target | Enterprise | SMB

Common Questions:
Q: "Do I need BTP skills for RISE?"
A: Yes, for extensions. But SAP provides consultants.

Q: "Can I switch from GROW to RISE?"
A: Yes, GROW is a stepping stone to RISE.

Q: "Is RISE just S/4HANA Cloud?"
A: No, it's S/4 + BTP + AI + Infrastructure + Services.

Resources:
â€¢ RISE FAQ: https://www.sap.com/products/erp/rise.html
â€¢ GROW FAQ: https://www.sap.com/products/erp/grow.html
notes.title: ðŸš€ SAP RISE & GROW (What You Need to Know)

notes.content:
Joule Studio is SAP's low-code platform to build custom Joule skills.

What You Can Build:
â€¢ Custom chatbot responses for company policies
â€¢ Task automation (e.g., "Approve all invoices under $500")
â€¢ Domain-specific queries (e.g., "What's our Q4 headcount forecast?")
â€¢ Integration with 3rd-party data (Salesforce, Workday)

How It Works:
1. Skill Builder - Define intent, entities, sample questions
2. Action Builder - Connect to SAP APIs (OData, REST)
3. Test Playground - Test skill with sample prompts
4. Deploy - Publish to Joule in SuccessFactors/S/4HANA

Example Skill:
"Show me open requisitions in San Francisco"
â†’ Calls SF Recruiting OData API
â†’ Filters by location = "San Francisco"
â†’ Returns results in conversational format

Key Links:
â€¢ Joule Studio: https://joule-studio.build.cloud.sap
â€¢ Skill Templates: https://help.sap.com/joule/studio
â€¢ Community: https://community.sap.com/topics/joule

Who Should Use This:
â€¢ Citizen developers (no coding required)
â€¢ Consultants building demo tenants
â€¢ Enterprises with unique business logic
notes.title: ðŸŽ¨ SAP Joule Studio (Build Custom AI Skills)

notes.content:
=== Universal Prompt Patterns (All SAP Solutions) ===

**Insight Request Pattern**:
"Analyze [object/scope] for [time period] and highlight [top drivers/risks/opportunities]. Present results as [table/summary/management brief]."

Example: "Analyze sales orders for Q1 2025 and highlight top 5 blockers. Present as management summary."

**Action + Explanation Pattern**:
"Perform [action] for [scope], then explain what you did and how it affects [business outcome]."

Example: "Create a draft invoice for PO 4500012345, then explain how this affects our cash flow forecast."

**Scenario Simulation Pattern**:
"Simulate [business change] and show the impact on [KPI] by [dimension], including recommendations."

Example: "Simulate a 10% price increase and show impact on revenue by product line with recommendations."

**Multi-Step Orchestration Pattern**:
"For [scope]: 1) [Step 1], 2) [Step 2], 3) [Step 3 with action]"

Example: "For customer ACME: 1) List open orders, 2) Flag risks, 3) Draft email to account manager with action plan."

=== Best Practices ===

âœ“ **Be Specific**: Use exact field names, time ranges, thresholds
âœ“ **Specify Format**: "5 bullet points", "table", "draft email I can paste"
âœ“ **Use Follow-Ups**: "Make this shorter", "Add more technical detail", "Adapt for executive audience"
âœ“ **Provide Context**: Include your role, constraints, business goal
âœ“ **Iterate**: Start broad, then refine with follow-up prompts

=== Common Mistakes ===

âœ— Too vague: "Show me sales data" â†’ âœ“ "Show top 10 customers by revenue for Q4 2024"
âœ— No time frame: "Analyze performance" â†’ âœ“ "Analyze performance for last 90 days"
âœ— No output format: "Give me info" â†’ âœ“ "Summarize in 3 bullet points"

=== Solution-Specific Libraries ===

Switch profiles to access detailed prompt libraries:
â€¢ SuccessFactors profile: HR/HCM prompts (performance, recruiting, learning)
â€¢ S/4HANA profile: Finance/ERP prompts (P&L, cash flow, procurement)
â€¢ BTP profile: Development prompts (CAP, AI Core, workflows)
